info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Transylvania, northwestern Greenville and northern Pickens Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Pickens, or 4 miles west of Table Rock State Park, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pickens, Table Rock State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Caesars Head State Park, Sunset, Pumpkintown, Sassafras Mountain, Cleveland and Rocky Bottom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
